text: Make the Pancake Batter Make the batter. In a large bowl, mix the flour, salt, egg, and half the milk. Whisk everything together with a wire whisk. Add the rest of the milk. Mix thoroughly again. Use a measuring cup with the batter. Pour the batter into a measuring cup for better pours. Add and mix in the melted butter. Refrigerate the batter. For the best results, refrigerate the batter for about 30 minutes. Make the Pancakes Place the pan over medium heat. Drizzle about a tablespoon of vegetable oil in a large saucepan. Allow the oil to slightly smoke. Pour the batter in the pan. Pour about 1 to 2 ladle-fulls of the mixture. Swirl it around so that it covers the entire pan. Turn the heat down slightly and leave the pancake to cook for 1-2 minutes. Flip the pancake. Cook on the other side for another minute until light brown. Remove the pancake once its cooked. Continue until you have six pancakes.  Make the Sauce Place the pan over medium heat. Drizzle about 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil in a large saucepan. Sauté the onions and garlic. Allow the onions to become translucent in color. Add the other ingredients. Add the tomatoes, 1 tsp of dried Italian herbs, tomato puree, sugar, salt, and pepper to the pan. Allow the mixture to simmer. Stir everything together and leave it to simmer for about 5 to 6 minutes. Puree the mixture. Transfer the mixture to a food processor and blend until smooth. Make the Pizzas Add the sauce to the pancakes. Add a few spoonfuls of the sauce onto each pancake and smooth over evenly. Add some grated cheese and then sprinkle over your toppings of choice.  Cook each pancake for 5 minutes. Allow the cheese to bubble. Season with black pepper and garnish with some fresh basil. Serve. Finished.
